webTitle: Tour de France: Jan Bakelants takes yellow jersey in second stage - video highlights

fields.standfirst: Radioshack Leopard rider Jan Bakelants won a tough second stage of the Tour de France, wresting the yellow jersey from first stage winner Marcel Kittel. Bakelants was part of a group of six who broke away from the peloton  with less than 7km of the 156km Bastia stage remaining. At the end of the race, Bakelants was the only one of the breakaway group left standing and raced the final kilometre looking over his shoulder as the peloton bore down on him

tags.bio: Alok Jha is a science correspondent at the Guardian. In addition to writing news and comment, he presents the Science Weekly podcast. A physics graduate from Imperial College London, he has been at the Guardian since the launch of the science supplement, Life, in 2003. He is the author of The Doomsday Handbook: 50 Ways to the End of the World and How To Live Forever And 34 Other Really Interesting Uses for Science, both published by Quercus. You can find him on Twitter at @alokjha and his personal website is at alokjha.com

Ian Sample has been a science correspondent for the Guardian since 2003. Before that, he was a journalist at New Scientist and worked at the Institute of Physics as a journal editor. He has a PhD in biomedical materials from Queen Mary's, University of London
